benchmark_details.name: XL-WiC
benchmark_details.overview: XL-WiC is a large multilingual benchmark for evaluating semantic contextualization, featuring gold standards in 12 languages and allowing for evaluation in scenarios such as zero-shot cross-lingual transfer.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a reliable evaluation framework for contextualized models across multiple languages, addressing the limitations of existing benchmarks that rely on sense inventories.

data.source: The dataset includes examples extracted from Multilingual WordNet and Wiktionary, curated to form positive (same sense) and negative (different senses) instances.
data.annotation: Instances were curated and validated with the aid of native speakers for each target language.

methodology.calculation: The accuracy is calculated as the ratio of correctly predicted instances (true positives or true negatives) to the total number of instances.
methodology.interpretation: Accuracy is used to evaluate model performance on the task of distinguishing different meanings of words in context.
methodology.baseline_results: Models trained on English WiC data were evaluated on XL-WiC with reported performance metrics.
methodology.validation: Manual evaluation was conducted on a subset of instances for reliability checking.
